page.name: Build a lesson in the Online Lesson Planner
page.intro: Build your lesson in the online form and save to share with colleagues.
page.content:
The online Lesson Planner is a tool that allows you to build a full lesson, following the WIPPEA model and incorporating backward design. Instructions for using the Lesson Planner are included on the site. Create a lesson plan using your objective and incorporating formative assessment strategies.

Use the Lesson Planner

  1. Go to the LINCS Lesson Planner. Click the Log In menu link at the top right of the page. Log in using the same e-mail address and password as you use to access this course in the LINCS Learning Portal.
  2. On the My LINCS page, choose My Lesson Plans in the left navigation bar.
  3. Choose Add a Lesson and begin building your lesson. Save your lesson at the end of each section—Basic Information, Objectives, Resources, and so on—by scrolling to the bottom of the form and choosing Save.
  4. After you save a section, choose Edit next the title of your lesson and continue building the lesson.
  5. After saving the completed lesson plan, copy the URL link so you can share it with your facilitator as you submit the assignment. You can also print the lesson for us in your classroom

Submit your Lesson

  1. Go back to the Effective Lesson Planning online course and find the assignment, The Lesson Planning Model.
  2. At the bottom of the page, choose Add submission.
  3. Paste the URL link for the lesson plan you created into the Online text box. Add your one-page journal reflection.
  4. Choose Save changes at the bottom of the page.
  5. When you are finished with the assignment, choose Submit assignment at the bottom of the page.
